relations.target: gangsta=10139610-n ((Black English) a member of a youth gang)

poor=08196123-n (people without possessions or wealth (considered as a group); \""the urban poor need assistance\"");01054589-a (deserving or inciting pity; \""a hapless victim\""; \""miserable victims of war\""; \""the shabby room struck her as extraordinarily pathetic\""- Galsworthy; \""piteous appeals for help\""; \""pitiable homeless children\""; \""a pitiful fate\""; \""Oh, you poor thing\""; \""his poor distorted limbs\""; \""a wretched life\"");02030204-a (having little money or few possessions; \""deplored the gap between rich and poor countries\""; \""the proverbial poor artist living in a garret\"");02031662-a (lacking in quality or substances; \""a poor land\""; \""the area was poor in timber and coal\""; \""food poor in nutritive value\""; \""the food in the cafeteria was of poor quality\"");02032876-a (characterized by or indicating poverty; \""the country had a poor economy\""; \""they lived in the poor section of town\"");02344882-a (of insufficient quantity to meet a need; \""an inadequate income\""; \""a poor salary\""; \""money is short\""; \""on short rations\""; \""food is in short supply\""; \""short on experience\""; \""the jejune diets of the very poor\""

struggle=00623308-n (strenuous effort; \""the struggle to get through the crowd exhausted her\"");00790634-n (an energetic attempt to achieve something; \""getting through the crowd was a real struggle\""; \""he fought a battle for recognition\"");00961007-n (an open clash between two opposing groups (or individuals); \""the harder the conflict the more glorious the triumph\""--Thomas Paine; \""police tried to control the battle between the pro- and anti-abortion mobs\"");01092746-v (be engaged in a fight; carry on a fight; \""the tribesmen fought each other\""; \""Siblings are always fighting\""; \""Militant groups are contending for control of the country\"");01507690-v (to exert strenuous effort against opposition; \""he struggled to get free from the rope\"");01925765-v (climb awkwardly, as if by scrambling);02412468-v (make a strenuous or labored effort; \""She struggled for years to survive without welfare\""; \""He fought for breath\""

life=00006269-n (living things collectively; \""the oceans are teeming with life\"");04639514-n (animation and energy in action or expression; \""it was a heavy play and the actors tried in vain to give life to it\"");05818587-n (the experience of being alive; the course of human events and activities; \""he could no longer cope with the complexities of life\"");06527818-n (an account of the series of events making up a person's life);09201624-n (a motive for living; \""pottery was his life\"");10280403-n (a living person; \""his heroism saved a life\"");11493691-n (the organic phenomenon that distinguishes living organisms from nonliving ones; \""there is no life on the moon\"");13984685-n (the course of existence of an individual; the actions and events that occur in living; \""he hoped for a new life in Australia\""; \""he wanted to live his own life without interference from others\""; \""get a life!\"" \""he is trying to rebuild his life\"");13984978-n (the condition of living or the state of being alive; \""while there's life there's hope\""; \""life depends on many chemical and physical processes\"");13986528-n (a characteristic state or mode of living; \""social life\""; \""city life\""; \""real life\"");15165365-n (the period during which something is functional (as between birth and death); \""the battery had a short life\""; \""he lived a long and happy life\"");15165704-n (the period between birth and the present time; \""I have known him all his life\"");15165852-n (the period from the present until death; \""he appointed himself emperor for life\"");15249872-n (a prison term lasting as long as the prisoner lives; \""he got life for killing the guard\""

senses.definition: A life in which one has to go through many struggles, like that of poor gangstas
